result.execSummary:
The defendant Shirley Hilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, assessments, surcharges and  DNA surcharge.  If not paid a civiljudgment is to be entered against the defendant.
Court advises the defendant:   he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the surcharge; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Maurtz F.
Take prescribed medications as prescribed and keep agent informed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shirley Hilson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shirley Hilson not in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) take prescribed medications as prescribed and keep agent informed; 4)  AODA, treatment or program; 5) no contact with Maurtz F.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve  90 days at the House of Correction with Huber for medical atreatment and 3 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

Defendant Shirley Hilson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Shirley Hilson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Due to the lateness of the hour and because counsel cannot return this afternoon, Court adjourns case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Shirley Hilson in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant was hospitalized and discharged this morning.  Court orders the bench warrant cancelled and the bail is reinstated.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 200.00.

Defendant Shirley Hilson not in court, defendant in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Shirley Hilson in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Kevin R Shomin for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Shirley Hilson in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Randy Sitzberger for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/9/14.
css

14RM024234  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-02-14

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Shirley Hilson in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Shirley Hilson in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Shirley Hilson not in court.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case is set for initial appearance.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4-10-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
